AnswerHash.pm

00001 ##########################################################################
00002 ## AnswerHash Package
00003 ##
00004 ## Provides a data structure for answer hashes. Currently just a wrapper
00005 ## for the hash, but that might change
00006 ####################################################################
00007 # Copyright @ 1995-2002 WeBWorK Team
00008 # All Rights Reserved
00009 ####################################################################
00010 #$Id$
00011 
00012 =head1 NAME
00013 
00014     AnswerHash.pm -- located in the courseScripts directory
00015     
00016     This file contains the packages/classes:
00017     AnswerHash   and AnswerEvaluator
00018 
00019 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00020 
00021     AnswerHash  -- this class stores information related to the student's
00022                answer.  It is little more than a standard perl hash with
00023                a special name, butit does have some access and 
00024                manipulation methods.  More of these may be added as it
00025                becomes necessary.
00026                
00027     Useage:    $rh_ans = new AnswerHash;
00028                
00029     AnswerEvaluator -- this class organizes the construction of
00030                answer evaluator subroutines which check the 
00031                student's answer.  By plugging filters into the
00032                answer evaluator class you can customize the way the
00033                student's answer is normalized and checked.  Our hope
00034                is that with properly designed filters, it will be
00035                possible to reuse the filters in different
00036                combinations to obtain different answer evaluators,
00037                thus greatly reducing the programming and maintenance
00038                required for constructing answer evaluators.
00039                
00040     Useage:     $ans_eval  = new AnswerEvaluator;
00041 
00042 =cut
00043 
00044 =head1 DESCRIPTION : AnswerHash
00045 
00046 The answer hash class is guaranteed to contain the following instance variables:
00047 
00048     score           =>  $correctQ,
00049     correct_ans     =>  $originalCorrEqn,
00050     student_ans     =>  $modified_student_ans
00051     original_student_ans    =>  $original_student_answer,
00052     ans_message     =>  $PGanswerMessage,
00053     type            =>  'typeString',
00054     preview_text_string =>  $preview_text_string,
00055     preview_latex_string    =>  $preview_latex_string
00056 
00057 
00058     $ans_hash->{score}      --  a number between 0 and 1 indicating
00059                         whether the answer is correct. Fractions
00060                         allow the implementation of partial
00061                         credit for incorrect answers.
00062 
00063     $ans_hash->{correct_ans}        --  The correct answer, as supplied by the
00064                         instructor and then formatted. This can
00065                         be viewed by the student after the answer date.
00066 
00067     $ans_hash->{student_ans}        --  This is the student answer, after reformatting;
00068                         for example the answer might be forced
00069                         to capital letters for comparison with
00070                         the instructors answer. For a numerical
00071                         answer, it gives the evaluated answer.
00072                         This is displayed in the section reporting
00073                         the results of checking the student answers.
00074 
00075     $ans_hash->{original_student_ans}   --  This is the original student answer. 
00076                          This is displayed on the preview page and may be used for
00077                          sticky answers.
00078 
00079     $ans_hash->{ans_message}        --  Any error message, or hint provided by 
00080                         the answer evaluator.
00081                         This is also displayed in the section reporting
00082                         the results of checking the student answers.
00083 
00084     $ans_hash->{type}           --  A string indicating the type of answer evaluator. 
00085                         This helps in preprocessing the student answer for errors.
00086                         Some examples:
00087                             'number_with_units'
00088                             'function'
00089                             'frac_number'
00090                             'arith_number'
00091 
00092 
00093     $ans_hash->{preview_text_string}    --
00094                         This typically shows how the student answer was parsed. It is
00095                         displayed on the preview page. For a student answer of 2sin(3x)
00096                         this would be 2*sin(3*x). For string answers it is typically the
00097                         same as $ans_hash{student_ans}.
00098 
00099 
00100     $ans_hash->{preview_latex_string}   --  
00101                         THIS IS OPTIONAL. This is latex version of the student answer
00102                         which is used to show a typeset view on the answer on the preview
00103                         page. For a student answer of 2/3, this would be \frac{2}{3}.
00104 
00105                         'ans_message'           =>  '', # null string
00106                                             
00107                         'preview_text_string'   =>  undef,
00108                         'preview_latex_string'  =>  undef,
00109                         'error_flag'            =>  undef,
00110                         'error_message'         =>  '',
00111 
00112 
00113 =head3 AnswerHash Methods:
00114 
00115 =cut
00116

00118     be_strict(); # an alias for use strict.  This means that all global variable must contain main:: as a prefix.
00119     
00120 }

00122 package AnswerHash;
00123 use Exporter;
00124 use PGcore qw(not_null pretty_print);
00125 
00126 # initialization fields
00127 my %fields = (      'score'                 =>  undef,
00128                     'correct_ans'           =>  undef,
00129                     'student_ans'           =>  undef,
00130                     'ans_message'           =>  undef,
00131                     'type'                  =>  undef,
00132                     'preview_text_string'   =>  undef,
00133                     'preview_latex_string'  =>  undef,
00134                     'original_student_ans'  =>  undef
00135             );
00136 
00137 ## Initializing constructor
00138 
00139 =head4 new
00140 
00141     Useage      $rh_anshash = new AnswerHash;
00142     
00143     returns an object of type AnswerHash.
00144     
00145 =cut
00146 
00147 sub new {
00148     my $class = shift @_;
00149     
00150     my $self  = {   'score'                 =>  0,
00151                     'correct_ans'           =>  'No correct answer specified',
00152                     'student_ans'           =>  undef,
00153                     'ans_message'           =>  '',
00154                     'ans_label'            =>   undef,
00155                     'type'                  =>  'Undefined answer evaluator type',
00156                     'preview_text_string'   =>  undef,
00157                     'preview_latex_string'  =>  undef,
00158                     'original_student_ans'  =>  undef,
00159                     'error_flag'            =>  undef,
00160                     'error_message'         =>  '',
00161 
00162     };  # return a reference to a hash.
00163     
00164     bless $self, $class;
00165     $self -> setKeys(@_);
00166     
00167     return $self;
00168 }
00169 
00170 ## IN: a hash
00171 ## Checks to make sure that the keys are valid,
00172 ## then sets their value
00173 
00174 =head4  setKeys     
00175             
00176             $rh_ans->setKeys(score=>1, student_answer => "yes");  
00177             Sets standard elements in the AnswerHash (the ones defined
00178             above). Will give error if one attempts to set non-standard keys.
00179             
00180             To set a non-standard element in a hash use
00181             
00182             $rh_ans->{non-standard-key} = newValue;
00183             
00184             There are no safety checks when using this method.
00185 
00186 =cut
00187 
00188  
00189 sub setKeys {
00190     my $self = shift;
00191     my %inits = @_;
00192     foreach my $item (keys %inits) {
00193         if ( exists $fields{$item} ) { 
00194             $self -> {$item} = $inits{$item};
00195         }
00196         else {
00197             warn "AnswerHash cannot automatically initialize an item named $item";
00198         }
00199     }
00200 }
00201 
00202 # access methods
00203 
00204 =head4 data
00205 
00206     Useage:     $rh_ans->data('foo');               set $rh_ans->{student_ans} = 'foo';
00207                 $student_input = $rh_ans->data();   retrieve value of $rh_ans->{student_ans}
00208     
00209     synonym for input
00210 
00211 =head4  input   
00212 
00213     Useage:     $rh_ans->input('foo')    sets $rh_ans->{student_ans} = 'foo';
00214                 $student_input = $rh_ans->input();
00215     
00216     synonym for data
00217 
00218 =cut
00219 
00220 sub data {    #$rh_ans->data('foo') is a synonym for $rh_ans->{student_ans}='foo'
00221     my $self = shift;
00222     $self->input(@_);
00223 }
00224 
00225 sub input {     #$rh_ans->input('foo') is a synonym for $rh_ans->{student_ans}='foo'
00226     my $self = shift;
00227     my $input = shift;
00228     $self->{student_ans} = $input if defined($input);
00229     $self->{student_ans}
00230 }
00231 
00232 =head4  input   
00233 
00234     Useage:     $rh_ans->score(1)    
00235                 $score = $rh_ans->score();
00236     
00237     Retrieve or set $rh_ans->{score}, the student's score on the problem.
00238 
00239 =cut
00240 
00241 sub score {     
00242     my $self = shift;
00243     my $score = shift;
00244     $self->{score} = $score if defined($score);
00245     $self->{score}
00246 }
00247 
00248 # error methods
00249 
00250 =head4 throw_error
00251 
00252     Useage: $rh_ans->throw_error("FLAG", "message");
00253     
00254     FLAG is a distinctive word that describes the type of error.  
00255     Examples are EVAL for an evaluation error or "SYNTAX" for a syntax error.
00256     The entry $rh_ans->{error_flag} is set to "FLAG".
00257     
00258     The catch_error and clear_error methods use
00259     this entry.
00260     
00261     message is a descriptive message for the end user, defining what error occured.
00262 
00263 =head4 catch_error
00264 
00265     Useage: $rh_ans->catch_error("FLAG2");
00266     
00267     Returns true (1) if  $rh_ans->{error_flag} equals "FLAG2", otherwise it returns
00268     false (empty string).
00269 
00270 
00271 
00272 =head4 clear_error
00273 
00274     Useage:  $rh_ans->clear_error("FLAG2");
00275     
00276     If $rh_ans->{error_flag} equals "FLAG2" then the {error_flag} entry is set to 
00277     the empty string as is the entry {error_message}
00278 
00279 =head4 error_flag
00280 
00281 =head4 error_message
00282 
00283     Useage:   $flag = $rh_ans -> error_flag();
00284             
00285               $message = $rh_ans -> error_message();
00286 
00287     Retrieve or set the {error_flag} and {error_message} entries. 
00288     
00289     Use catch_error and throw_error where possible.
00290 
00291 =cut
00292 
00293 
00294 
00295 sub throw_error {
00296     my $self = shift;
00297     my $flag = shift;
00298     my $message = shift;
00299     $self->{error_message} .= " $message " if defined($message);
00300     $self->{error_flag} = $flag if defined($flag);
00301     $self->{error_flag}
00302 }
00303 sub catch_error {
00304     my $self = shift;
00305     my $flag = shift;
00306     return('')  unless defined($self->{error_flag});
00307     return $self->{error_flag} unless $flag;    # empty input catches all errors.
00308     return $self->{error_flag} if $self->{error_flag} eq $flag;
00309     return '';   # nothing to catch
00310 }
00311 sub clear_error {
00312     my $self = shift;
00313     my $flag = shift;
00314     if (defined($flag) and $flag =~/\S/ and defined($self->{error_flag})  and $flag eq $self->{error_flag}) {
00315         $self->{error_flag} = undef;
00316         $self->{error_message} = undef;
00317     }
00318     $self;
00319 }
00320 sub error_flag {
00321     my $self = shift;
00322     my $flag = shift;
00323     $self->{error_flag} = $flag if defined($flag);
00324     $self->{error_flag}
00325 }
00326 sub error_message {
00327     my $self = shift;
00328     my $message = shift;
00329     $self->{error_message} = $message if defined($message);
00330     $self->{error_message}
00331 }

00377 
00378 # action methods    
00379 
00380 =head4 OR
00381 
00382     Useage:    $rh_ans->OR($rh_ans2);
00383     
00384     Returns a new AnswerHash whose score is the maximum of the scores in $rh_ans and $rh_ans2.
00385     The correct answers for the two hashes are combined with "OR".  
00386     The types are concatenated with "OR" as well.
00387     Currently nothing is done with the error flags and messages.
00388 
00389 
00390 
00391 =head4 AND
00392 
00393 
00394     Useage:    $rh_ans->AND($rh_ans2);
00395     
00396     Returns a new AnswerHash whose score is the minimum of the scores in $rh_ans and $rh_ans2.
00397     The correct answers for the two hashes are combined with "AND". 
00398     The types are concatenated with "AND" as well.
00399      Currently nothing is done with the error flags and messages.
00400 
00401 
00402 
00403 
00404 =cut
00405 
00406 
00407 
00408 sub OR {
00409     my $self = shift;
00410     
00411     my $rh_ans2 = shift;
00412     my %options = @_;
00413     return($self) unless defined($rh_ans2) and ref($rh_ans2) eq 'AnswerHash';
00414     
00415     my $out_hash = new AnswerHash;
00416     # score is the maximum of the two scores
00417     $out_hash->{score} = ( $self->{score}  <  $rh_ans2->{score} ) ? $rh_ans2->{score} :$self->{score};
00418     $out_hash->{correct_ans} = join(" OR ", $self->{correct_ans}, $rh_ans2->{correct_ans} );
00419     $out_hash->{student_ans} = $self->{student_ans};
00420     $out_hash->{type} = join(" OR ", $self->{type}, $rh_ans2->{type} );
00421     $out_hash->{preview_text_string} = join("   ", $self->{preview_text_string}, $rh_ans2->{preview_text_string} );
00422     $out_hash->{original_student_ans} = $self->{original_student_ans};
00423     $out_hash;
00424 }
00425 
00426 sub AND {
00427     my $self = shift;
00428     my $rh_ans2 = shift;
00429     my %options = @_;
00430     my $out_hash = new AnswerHash;
00431     # score is the minimum of the two scores
00432     $out_hash->{score} = ( $self->{score}  >  $rh_ans2->{score} ) ? $rh_ans2->{score} :$self->{score};
00433     $out_hash->{correct_ans} = join(" AND ", $self->{correct_ans}, $rh_ans2->{correct_ans} );
00434     $out_hash->{student_ans} = $self->{student_ans};
00435     $out_hash->{type} = join(" AND ", $self->{type}, $rh_ans2->{type} );
00436     $out_hash->{preview_text_string} = join("  ", $self->{preview_text_string}, $rh_ans2->{preview_text_string} );
00437     $out_hash->{preview_latex_string} = join(" \\quad ", $self->{preview_latex_string}, $rh_ans2->{preview_latex_string} );
00438     $out_hash->{original_student_ans} = $self->{original_student_ans};
00439     $out_hash;
00440 }

00452 package AnswerEvaluator;
00453 use Exporter;
00454 use PGcore qw(not_null pretty_print);
00455 
00456 =head3 AnswerEvaluator Methods
00457

00467 =head4 new
00468

00472 
00473 sub new {
00474     my $class = shift @_;
00475     
00476     my $self  = {   pre_filters     =>  [ [\&blank_prefilter] ],
00477                     evaluators      =>  [],
00478                     post_filters    =>  [ [\&blank_postfilter] ],
00479                     debug           =>  0,
00480                     rh_ans      =>  new AnswerHash,
00481                     
00482     };
00483     
00484     bless $self, $class;
00485     $self->rh_ans(@_);    #initialize answer hash   
00486     return $self;
00487 }
00488 
00489 # dereference_array_ans pretty prints an answer which is stored as an anonymous array.
00490 sub dereference_array_ans {
00491     my $self = shift;
00492     my $rh_ans = shift;
00493     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'dereference_array_ans';
00494     if (defined($rh_ans->{student_ans}) and ref($rh_ans->{student_ans}) eq 'ARRAY'  ) {
00495         $rh_ans->{student_ans} = "( ". join(" , ",@{$rh_ans->{student_ans}} ) . " ) ";
00496     }
00497     $rh_ans;
00498 }
00499     
00500 sub get_student_answer {
00501     my $self           = shift;
00502     my $input          = shift; 
00503     my %answer_options = @_;
00504     my $display_input  = $input;
00505     $display_input =~ s/\0/\\0/g;  # make null spacings visible
00506     warn "Raw student answer is |$display_input|" if $self->{debug};
00507     $input = '' unless defined($input); 
00508     if (ref($input) =~/AnswerHash/) {
00509         # in this case nothing needs to be done, since the student's answer is already in an answerhash.
00510         # This is useful when an AnswerEvaluator is used as a filter in another answer evaluator.
00511     } elsif ($input =~ /\0/ ) {  # this case may occur with older versions of CGI??
00512         my @input = split(/\0/,$input);
00513         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {original_student_ans} = " ( " .join(", ",@input) . " ) ";
00514         $input = \@input;
00515         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {student_ans} = $input;
00516     } elsif (ref($input) eq 'ARRAY' ) {  # sometimes the answer may already be decoded into an array.   
00517         my @input = @$input;
00518         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {original_student_ans} = " ( " .join(", ",@input) . " ) ";
00519         $input = \@input;
00520         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {student_ans} = $input;
00521     } else {
00522         
00523         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {original_student_ans} = $input;
00524         $self-> {rh_ans} -> {student_ans} = $input;
00525     }
00526     $self->{rh_ans}->{ans_label}   = $answer_options{ans_label} if defined($answer_options{ans_label}); 
00527     $self->{rh_ans}->{_filter_name} = 'get_student_answer';
00528     $input;
00529 }
00530 
00531 =head4  evaluate
00532 
00533     $answer_evaluator->evaluate($student_answer_string
00534 
00535 
00536 =cut
00537 our $count;   # used to keep track of where we are in queue
00538 
00539 sub evaluate {
00540     my $self        =   shift;
00541     $self->get_student_answer(@_);
00542     # dereference $self->{rh_ans};
00543     my $rh_ans      =   $self ->{rh_ans};
00544     $rh_ans->{error_flag}=undef;  #reset the error flags in case 
00545     $rh_ans->{done}=undef;        #the answer evaluator is called twice
00546     
00547     warn "<H3> Answer evaluator information: </H3>\n" if defined($self->{debug}) and $self->{debug}>0;
00548     $self->print_result_if_debug('pre_filter',$rh_ans);
00549     
00550     my @prefilters  = @{$self -> {pre_filters}};
00551     $count = 0;  # the get student answer filter is counted as filter -1
00552     foreach my $i   (@prefilters) {
00553         last if defined( $rh_ans->{error_flag} );
00554         my @array = @$i;
00555         my $filter = shift(@array);      # the array now contains the options for the filter
00556         $rh_ans = &$filter($rh_ans,@array);
00557         $self->print_result_if_debug('pre_filter',$rh_ans,@array);
00558     }
00559     my @evaluators = @{$self -> {evaluators} };
00560     $count = 0;
00561     foreach my $i ( @evaluators )   {
00562         last if defined($rh_ans->{error_flag});
00563         my @array = @$i;
00564         my $evaluator = shift(@array);   # the array now contains the options for the filter
00565         $rh_ans = &$evaluator($rh_ans,@array);
00566         $self->print_result_if_debug('evaluator',$rh_ans,@array);
00567     }
00568     my @post_filters = @{$self -> {post_filters} };
00569     $count = 0;  # blank filter catcher is filter 0
00570     foreach my $i ( @post_filters ) {
00571         last if defined($rh_ans->{done}) and $rh_ans->{done} == 1;    # no further action needed
00572         my @array = @$i;
00573         my $filter = shift(@array);      # the array now contains the options for the filter
00574         $rh_ans = &$filter($rh_ans,@array);
00575         $self->print_result_if_debug('post_filter',$rh_ans,@array);
00576     }
00577     $rh_ans = $self->dereference_array_ans($rh_ans);
00578     # make sure that the student answer is not an array so that it is reported correctly in answer section.
00579     warn "<h4>final result: </h4>", $rh_ans->pretty_print() if defined($self->{debug}) and $self->{debug}>0;
00580     # re-refrence $rh_ans;
00581     $self ->{rh_ans} = $rh_ans;
00582     $rh_ans;
00583 }
00584 sub print_result_if_debug {
00585     my $self = shift;
00586     my $queue = shift;    # the name of the queue we are in
00587     my $rh_ans= shift;
00588     my %options = @_;
00589     if (defined($self->{debug}) and $self->{debug}>0) {
00590             $rh_ans->{rh_options} = \%options;  #include the options in the debug information
00591             my $name = (defined($rh_ans->{_filter_name})) ? $rh_ans->{_filter_name}: 'unnamed';
00592             warn "$count. Result from \"$name\" $queue:", $rh_ans->pretty_print();
00593             ++$count;   
00594      }
00595     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = undef;
00596 }
00597 
00598 # This next subroutine is for checking the instructor's answer and is not yet in use.
00599 # sub correct_answer_evaluate {
00600 #   my $self        =   shift;
00601 #   $self-> {rh_ans} -> {correct_ans} = shift @_;
00602 #   my $rh_ans    =   $self ->{rh_ans}; 
00603 #   my @prefilters  = @{$self -> {correct_answer_pre_filters}};
00604 #   my $count = -1;  # the blank filter is counted as filter 0
00605 #   foreach my $i   (@prefilters) {
00606 #       last if defined( $rh_ans->{error_flag} );
00607 #       my @array = @$i;
00608 #       my $filter = shift(@array);      # the array now contains the options for the filter
00609 #       warn "before pre-filter: ",++$count, $self->{rh_ans}->pretty_print() if defined($self->{debug}) and $self->{debug}>0;
00610 #       $rh_ans     = &$filter($rh_ans,@array);
00611 #       warn "Filter Name:", $rh_ans->{_filter_name},"<BR>\n" if $self->{debug}>0 and defined($rh_ans->{_filter_name})

00640 =head4 install_pre_filter
00641 
00642 =head4 install_evaluator
00643 
00644 
00645 =head4 install_post_filter
00646 
00647 
00648 
00649 =cut
00650 
00651 sub install_pre_filter {
00652     my $self =  shift;
00653     if (@_ == 0) {
00654         # do nothing if input is empty
00655     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00656         $self->{pre_filters} = [];
00657     } else {
00658         push(@{$self->{pre_filters}},[ @_ ]) if @_;  #install pre_filter and it's options
00659     }
00660     @{$self->{pre_filters}};  # return array of all pre_filters
00661 }
00662 
00663 
00664 
00665 
00666 
00667 sub install_evaluator {
00668     my $self =  shift;
00669     if (@_ == 0) {
00670         # do nothing if input is empty
00671     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00672         $self->{evaluators} = [];
00673     } else {
00674         push(@{$self->{evaluators}},[ @_ ]) if @_; #install evaluator and it's options
00675     }
00676     @{$self->{'evaluators'}};  # return array of all evaluators
00677 }
00678 
00679 
00680 sub install_post_filter {
00681     my $self =  shift;
00682     if (@_ == 0) {
00683         # do nothing if input is empty
00684     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00685         $self->{post_filters} = [];
00686     } else {
00687         push(@{$self->{post_filters}}, [ @_ ]) if @_; #install post_filter and it's options
00688     }
00689     @{$self->{post_filters}};  # return array of all post_filters
00690 }

00696         # do nothing if input is empty
00697     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {
00698         $self->{correct_answer_pre_filters} = [];
00699     } else {
00700         push(@{$self->{correct_answer_pre_filters}},[ @_ ]) if @_;  #install correct_answer_pre_filter and it's options
00701     }
00702     @{$self->{correct_answer_pre_filters}};  # return array of all correct_answer_pre_filters
00703 }

00708         # do nothing if input is empty
00709     } elsif ($_[0] eq 'reset' or $_[0] eq 'erase' ) {

00728 
00729 =head4 withPreFilter
00730 
00731     $answerHash->withPreFilter(filter[,options]);
00732 
00733     Installs a prefilter (possibly with options), and returns the AnswerHash. This is so that you
00734     can add a filter to a checker without having to save the checker in a variable, e.g.,
00735 
00736         ANS(Real(10)->cmp->withPreFilter(...));
00737 
00738     or
00739 
00740         ANS(num_cmp(10)->withPreFilter(...));
00741 
00742 =cut
00743 
00744 sub withPreFilter {
00745   my $self = shift;
00746   $self->install_pre_filter(@_);
00747   return $self;
00748 }
00749 
00750 =head4 withPostFilter
00751 
00752     $answerHash->withPostFilter(filter[,options]);
00753 
00754     Installs a postfilter (possibly with options), and returns the AnswerHash. This is so that you
00755     can add a filter to a checker without having to save the checker in a variable, e.g.,
00756 
00757         ANS(Real(10)->cmp->withPostFilter(...));
00758 
00759     or
00760 
00761         ANS(num_cmp(10)->withPostFilter(...));
00762 
00763 =cut
00764 
00765 sub withPostFilter {
00766   my $self = shift;
00767   $self->install_post_filter(@_);
00768   return $self;
00769 }
00770 
00771 sub ans_hash {  #alias for rh_ans
00772     my $self = shift;
00773     $self->rh_ans(@_);
00774 }       
00775 sub rh_ans {
00776     my $self = shift;
00777     my %in_hash = @_;
00778     foreach my $key (keys %in_hash) {
00779         $self->{rh_ans}->{$key} = $in_hash{$key};
00780     }
00781     $self->{rh_ans};
00782 }
00783 
00784 =head1 Description: Filters
00785 
00786 A filter is a subroutine which takes one AnswerHash as an input, followed by 
00787 a hash of options.
00788 
00789         Useage:  filter($ans_hash, option1 =>value1, option2=> value2 );
00790         
00791 
00792 The filter performs some operations on the input AnswerHash and returns an
00793 AnswerHash as output.
00794 
00795 Many AnswerEvaluator objects are merely a sequence of filters placed into
00796 three queues:
00797 
00798     pre_filters:    these normalize student input, prepare text and so forth
00799     evaluators:     these decide whether or not an answer is correct
00800     post_filters:   typically these clean up error messages or process errors 
00801                     and generate error messages.
00802 
00803 If a filter detects an error it can throw an error message using the C<$rh_ans->throw_error()>
00804 method.  This skips the AnswerHash by all remaining pre_filter C<$rh_ans->catch_error>,
00805 decides how (
00806 or whether) it is supposed to handle the error and then passes the result on
00807 to the next post_filter.  
00808 
00809 Setting the flag C<$rh_ans->{done} = 1> will skip 
00810 the AnswerHash past the remaining post_filters.  
00811 
00812 
00813 =head3 Built in filters
00814 
00815 =head4 blank_prefilter
00816 
00817 
00818 =head4 blank_postfilter
00819 
00820 =cut
00821 
00822 ######################################################
00823 #
00824 # Built in Filters
00825 #
00826 ######################################################
00827 
00828 
00829 sub blank_prefilter  { # check for blanks
00830     my $rh_ans = shift;  
00831     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'blank_prefilter';
00832     # undefined answers are BLANKS
00833     ( not defined($rh_ans->{student_ans}) ) && do {$rh_ans->throw_error("BLANK", 'The answer is blank');
00834                                                       return($rh_ans);};
00835     # answers which are arrays or hashes or some other object reference  are NOT blanks
00836     ( ref($rh_ans->{student_ans} )        ) && do { return( $rh_ans ) };
00837     # if the answer is a true variable consisting only of white space it is a BLANK
00838     ( ($rh_ans->{student_ans}) !~ /\S/   )    && do {$rh_ans->throw_error("BLANK", 'The answer is blank');
00839                                                       return($rh_ans);};
00840     # If we get to here, we assume that the answer is not a blank. It is defined, not a reference
00841     # and contains something other than whitespaces.
00842     $rh_ans;
00843 };
00844 
00845 sub blank_postfilter  { 
00846     my $rh_ans=shift;
00847     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'blank_postfilter';
00848     return($rh_ans) unless defined($rh_ans->{error_flag}) and $rh_ans->{error_flag} eq 'BLANK';
00849     $rh_ans->{error_flag} = undef;
00850     $rh_ans->{error_message} = '';
00851     $rh_ans->{done} =1;    # no further checking is needed.
00852     $rh_ans;
00853 };
00854 
00855 1;
